org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient
Class ClientMessageToServer

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient.ClientMessageToServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatagramEncoder
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientMessageToServerByeBye, ClientMessageToServerPingPong
public abstract class ClientMessageToServer
extends Object
implements DatagramEncoder

Provides a default DatagramEncoder implementation that returns an empty string. The encode() method implemented can be used (by not overriding it in sub classes) when only the message id is important (for example with Ping Pong messages, which have no content).

With this base class a message may encode itself to a String. This interface is used to translate messages into so called Binary Packets, or datagrams.

A response string needs to built up in the following format:
message code (3), encoded string

The following example could of a login response: 005OK
The following example could of a pong notification: 999

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
SwiftSocketClient.addServerResponse(ServerMessageToClient), SwiftSocketClient.getNextServerResponse(), DatagramEncoder.encode()

Method Detail

encode

public String encode()
Default implementation which returns an empty string. This is useful for messages that have no parameters, just a message code.

Specified by:
encode in interface DatagramEncoder
Returns:
The response String or binary packet, without the response code.
See Also:
DatagramEncoder.encode()
